intro: Cystacanthus yangtsekiangensis, commonly known as the Yangtze river cystacanthus, is a rare aquatic plant found in specific freshwater habitats in China. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its submerged, branching stems and small, spirally arranged leaves. The plant plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life. Its reproductive structures are unique, with flowers that are typically small and inconspicuous, adapted for pollination by waterborne agents. Due to habitat degradation, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
